definition: variant of 趟渾水|趟浑水[tang1 hun2 shui3]
to wade/to trample
muddy/to mix
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
(fig.) to get involved in an unsavory enterprise
to mix/to mingle/to interfere/to meddle
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
not to get involved/to stay out of it
stir up the fire and you get burnt (idiom); to get one's fingers burnt/fig. to suffer on account of one's own meddling
to invite a snub/to court a rebuff
(coll.) to cause trouble for sb/to inconvenience
to cause trouble
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
meddling in other people's business
see 撕破臉|撕破脸[si1 po4 lian3]
to provoke/to tease
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
to cause sth unfortunate to happen (to oneself or sb else)/to do sth inauspicious/to have a stroke of bad luck
to wallow in the mire with sb (idiom); to follow the bad example of others
lit. to pull sb into the water/to involve sb in a messy business/to get sb into trouble
